titleStmt.title: Partial Manuscripts Schema, constrained for usage in XForms
titleStmt.author: Maximilian de Molière
Nathan Gibson
Maximilian de Molière

publicationStmt.authority: Institut für den Nahen und Mittleren Osten
publicationStmt.publisher: ERC-funded project: MAJLIS. The Transformation of Jewish Literature in Arabic in the Islamicate World

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

revisionDesc.change: Created schema on basis of Arabic Manuscripts Schema created by Pietro Liuzzo

div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript support using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

moduleRef.except: list abbr add biblScope binaryObject ellipsis emph expan foreign gap graphic imprint item measureGrp p noteGrp orig teiCorpus textLang addrLine address analytic author bibl biblStruct cb choice cit citedRange corr date del desc distinct divGen editor email gb gloss head headItem headLabel hi index l label lb lg listBibl media meeting mentioned milestone monogr name num pb postBox postCode ptr pubPlace publisher q quote rb ref reg relatedItem resp respStmt rs rt ruby said series sic soCalled sp speaker stage street term time title unclear

moduleRef.include: catchwords collation condition dimensions foliation height locus material objectDesc origDate origPlace

elementSpec.desc: Specify range of folios of a text within the manuscript.
Describe the means used to ensure the order of quires.
Supply information on quiring and catchwords. For additional observations use the free text box.
Describe the general state of conservation.
Distinguish between foliation and pagination. Describe the numbering system (Arabic numerals, Hebrew letters etc.). If necessary create multiple fields for different numbering systems exhibited.
Choose from the list.
Contains descriptions of the manuscript's physical components. Use the "form" attribute to indicate if the manuscript was created as a single unit, a composite, or a multiple text manuscript.
Fill in the date in CE. The date given here refers to the writing material (and not the production of the copy).

Look up the place records. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. The place given here refers to the writing material (and not the production of the copy).
This element contains descriptions of the codicological and paleographic features of a manuscript.
Add observations on fields mentioned above.
Measure the height in millimeters.
Measure the width in millimeters.
Specify total number of folios.
Provide measurements of the folio.
Describe the writing material in detail using the provided fields.
This element contains descriptions of the writing material in various child elements.
Provide total number of folios and measurements. Base your observations on folios and not pages or bifolios.

Specify the number of bifolia per quire. Describe deviations from the general quiring model (shortened or enlarged quires) in the free text box. You can link to VizColl for detailed description and visualisation of quire structure.
Describe the general state of legibility or conservation of the writing / ink. If only particular areas are damaged, specify so in the note field.
